content.text: Add OneEntry SDK to your Swift project

inlineContent.text: In order to create a OneEntry project, you need to create an account on our
tab and create a new project.

content.text: Step 2: Add OneEntry SDK to your app

inlineContent.text: is a dependency manager for Cocoa projects. For usage and installation instructions, visit their website. To integrate OneEntry into your Xcode project using CocoaPods, specify it in your
If you have this error as a result of installing Sdk, via CocoaPods, add the following code to your Podfile

code: # Comment the next line if you don't want to use dynamic frameworks

inlineContent.text: is a tool for automating the distribution of Swift code and is integrated into the swift compiler.
Once you have your Swift package set up, adding OneEntry as a dependency is as easy as adding it to the dependencies value of your Package.swift.

content.text: Step 3: Initialize OneEntry in your app

inlineContent.text: This is the final step you need to take in order to add OneEntry to your application.
Before using SDK classes and methods, you need to go through initialization.
Otherwise there will be an error
To initialize with an authorization token, you need to get a link to the project and the token. You can do this in the project settings in the tab
shared instance, before using SDK methods. The
method is best suited for this.
iOS Sdk OneEntry uses .p12(PKCS#12) certificates for authorization. Such a certificate can be generated independently from the
pair or use the one provided by OneEntry
In any case, you need to download the archive with certificates. You can do this in the project settings, in the
The following files will be inside:
Move the .p12 file to the project, make sure it is included in Target Membership
method is best suited for this.
By default, OneEntry certificates do not have a password

Using the certificate and password you specified when creating it, initialize the application. The
method is best suited for this.

inlineContent.text: Three scenarios are supported for this:
You can customize the message template in the event settings in your personal account
After setting up the necessary event, we can start code generation.
Password or registration codes are checked by
To check the user code, use the

code: let success = try await AuthService.shared.check(email, code: code, with: "email")
### Changing the password in case of loss of access to the account
Changing the password in case the user has forgotten it
To change the password in case of its loss, you should follow a few steps:
1. Send verification code by user ID
2. Change the password using the activation code
> ImPortant: Use this instruction only if you lose access to your account. Otherwise, you should use ``AuthService/changeUser(form:langCode:data:)``

inlineContent.text: Management of user data such as password, names, etc.
User authorization works on the principle of token exchange.
For the sake of simplicity, hide this process under the hood of the sdk. On
You always have the opportunity to get all the data for more detailed configuration.
Tokens are automatically saved in a keychain to implement auto login.
This method performs obtaining authorization tokens. SDK independently monitor their relevance.
The method for obtaining user information is available only after successful authorization via sdk
In fact, the output can be implemented in different ways and without this method.
However, its call is necessary to cancel authorization tokens

code: let success = try await service.changeUser(form: "email_auth", langCode: "en_US") {

inlineContent.text: Registration and activation of new users. Verification using activation code.
OneEntry users can be created through your personal account on the website, or using our sdk.
In both cases, you must first configure the authentication provider.
There you can configure many parameters, such as seret phrases, token formats, etc.
But the most important thing is the authorization form.
After setting up the authorization provider, we can proceed to user registration.
User registration supports sending data to an additional form using the
- is responsible for the authorization data we configured above
After a successful registration request, a confirmation code will be automatically sent to the selected address
User activation is needed to verify the authenticity of his data.
Without user activation, methods of working with him, such as authorization, will not work

code: let success = try await AuthService.shared.activate(user: email, code: otp, with: "email")

inlineContent.text: Sometimes you need to be able to get information about an attribute. Most often, this requires to get all the elements of the list: all colors, stickers, etc. This service will help to solve this problem

content.text: Getting all attributes within the set

inlineContent.text: This method allows you to get all the attributes within the set. Sets are tied to OneEntry entities (products, blocks, pages, etc.)

code: let attributes = try await AttributesService.shared.attributes(from: "all", langCode: "en_US")

content.text: Getting a single attribute within a set

inlineContent.text: This method can be useful if you know where to look for the necessary attribute and need to get information about it

code: let attribute = try await AttributesService.shared.attribute(with: "list", from: "all", langCode: "en_US")

inlineContent.text: The result of this method does not include the content of product blocks
OneEntry Forms is a tool that allows you to store, receive and send user data.
This can be applied in many scenarios, such as users, orders, etc.
In your personal account, you can configure the template of the received data by creating a form and attaching attributes to it.
You may need to get information about the form. To do this, you can request information about all forms:
Or some specific one according to her identifier:

code: let form = try await FormsService.shared.form(with: "delivery", langCode: "en_US")

inlineContent.text: The main idea of the forms is to send data to them. This can be done using the method

code: let response = try await FormsService.shared.sendData(with: "delivery", locale: "en_US") {

OneEntry has a list attribute. It allows you to create a drop-down list in the admin panel and select some basic product settings (color sticker, etc.). For ease of use, any element of the list can be expanded with an additional parameter.
You can get the element that expands the list through the model field
Most types of attributes can be obtained as a string

OneEntry supports the ability to save your files to storage. To do this, you need to specify additional information about the file.
| fileURL  | Path to the file you want to save                                                                   |
|   type   | Type, determines the folder name in the storage                                                     |
|  entity  | Entity name from which the file is uploaded, determines the folder name in the storage              |
|    id    | identifier of the object from which the file is uploaded, determines the folder name in the storage |
| compress | Boolean flag of optimization (compression) for images                                               |

code: let result = try await ProjectService.shared.uploadFile(fileURL: url, type: "page", entity: "test", id: 15)

inlineContent.text: array will be returned as a response

code: /// Represents a file associated with a single entry.
/// The full path to the file.
/// The download link or URL for accessing the file.
/// The size of the file in bytes.

inlineContent.text: This SDK method allows you to delete saved files. Additional fields must also be specified for it.
|  type  | Type, determines the folder name in the storage                                                     |
| entity | Entity name from which the file is uploaded, determines the folder name in the storage              |
|   id   | identifier of the object from which the file is uploaded, determines the folder name in the storage |

code: try await ProjectService.shared.deleteFile(name: name, type: "page", entity: "test", id: 15)

inlineContent.text: The menu is a very important essence of OneEntry. It allows you to group pages by features. These pages will be returned as a tree, and you can easily get all the subpages (children) of each page
